By http://www.readersdigest.ca

5 Things To Do with Umbrellas

      Play
      Pause
      • Slow
      • Medium
      • Fast
      View first image

Going to throw out that old, broken umbrella? Let it give you a hand and save you space around your home and garden.

A Drying Rack

An old umbrella makes a handy drying rack. Just strip off the fabric and hang the fame upside down from your shower-curtain bar. Attach wet clothing with clothes pegs. Plus, your new drying rack folds up for storage.

Also see:

  • 5 things to do with hairspray
  • 5 things to do with sandwich bags
  • 5 things to do with ... everything! Check out our new section

More from Reader's Digest

  • 5 Things To Do with Garden Hoses
  • 5 Tips to Make Your Home Look Fabulous
  • 8 Ways to Avoid Hotel Germs

Follow MSN.ca Lifestyle (@MSNcaLS) on Twitter!

By http://www.readersdigest.ca
5 Things To Do with Umbrellas

Make Plant Stakes

      Play
      Pause
      • Slow
      • Medium
      • Fast
      Previous
    • 1 of 4
      Next

Larger image

If the wind caught your umbrella, turned it inside out and ripped the fabric, don’t just toss it in the trash. Remove the umbrella’s ribs first, as they make excellent supports for top-heavy garden plants, such as peonies.

Also see:

  • 5 things to do with hairspray
  • 5 things to do with sandwich bags
  • 5 things to do with ... everything! Check out our new section

  • 8 Ways to Avoid Hotel Germs

By http://www.readersdigest.ca
5 Things To Do with Umbrellas

Cover Your Picnic Food

      Play
      Pause
      • Slow
      • Medium
      • Fast
      Previous
    • 2 of 4
      Next

Larger image

To keep flies from feasting on your picnic before you do, open an old umbrella and cut off the handle. Place the umbrella over the picnic dishes. It will shield your lunchtime treats from the sun, too.

Also see:

  • 5 things to do with hairspray
  • 5 things to do with sandwich bags
  • 5 things to do with ... everything! Check out our new section

By http://www.readersdigest.ca
5 Things To Do with Umbrellas

Cover Your Picnic Food

      Play
      Pause
      • Slow
      • Medium
      • Fast
      Previous
    • 2 of 4
      Next

Larger image

To keep flies from feasting on your picnic before you do, open an old umbrella and cut off the handle. Place the umbrella over the picnic dishes. It will shield your lunchtime treats from the sun, too.

Also see:

  • 5 things to do with hairspray
  • 5 things to do with sandwich bags
  • 5 things to do with ... everything! Check out our new section

5 Things To Do with Umbrellas

Make an Instant Trellis

      Play
      Pause
      • Slow
      • Medium
      • Fast
      Previous
    • 3 of 4
      Next

Larger image

Remove the fabric from an old umbrella and insert the handle into the ground to support climbing vines, such as morning glories or sweet peas. The umbrella’s shape, covered with flowers, will look terrific in the garden.

  • 5 things to do with hairspray

By http://www.readersdigest.ca
5 Things To Do with Umbrellas

Shield Your Seedlings

      Play
      Pause
      • Slow
      • Medium
      • Fast
      Previous
    • 4 of 4
      Next
X
    • Replay this gallery
    • Go back to item 1 of this gallery
    • Go back to the summary page for this gallery

View More Galleries:

Larger image

If you waited long enough before planting your seedlings outside and then a frost is unexpectedly predicted, you can use an old umbrella to save the seedlings. Open the umbrella, then cut off the handle. Place the umbrella over the seedlings to the frost off them.
